events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle on the highway causing rear-end damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under 'Auto Accident' due to keywords identified in the initial report.
An agent specialized in auto claims was assigned to handle the customer's case for further processing.
Acknowledgment sent to the customer confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and outlining next steps.
Customer was requested to submit photos of the damaged vehicle and police accident report for verification.
Customer uploaded required images of the car damage along with the official police accident report as requested.
Investigation team began analyzing the accident details and reports to determine the claim validity and liability.
The investigation concluded confirming the accident circumstances correspond with customerâ€™s claim.
A settlement offer was proposed based on repair cost estimates and policy coverage for the auto accident.
Customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the communication.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager after all conditions and documentation were verified.
Payment for the approved claim was issued to the customer's bank account to cover vehicle repair expenses.
The claim was closed successfully after confirming receipt of payment and customer acceptance.
All claim files and records were archived according to company policy for auto accident claims.
